intro: Pseudocarpidium domingense, commonly known as the Dominican pseudocarpidium, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
